identificationModule.briefTitle: Multimodal Retinal Imaging of Cerebrovascular Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: Multimodal Retinal Imaging of Cerebrovascular Stroke

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
The hypothesis is that in patients with stroke, abnormalities of retinal microvascularization shown on color fundus photography and the depletion of retinal capillary density evaluated by OCT-A are markers of acute impairment of microcirculation of the central nervous system and are correlated with lesions on brain imaging.

Patients hospitalized for stroke MRI-confirmed, will be included. An ophthalmologic assessment including color fundus photography (CFP) and OCT-A will be carried out after stabilization and at 3 months follow-up. Outcomes assessor will be blinded.

interventions.name: color fundus photography (CFP) and OCT-A
interventions.description: Included patients will have an ophthalmologic assessment (OCT-A and CPF) after stabilization and at 3 months follow-up.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Presence of an anomaly in color fundus photography or an anomaly of retinal capillary density to OCT-A

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion criteria:

* Acute ischemic stroke
* With cerebral microangiopathy (defined by a SVD score \> 1)

Exclusion criteria:

* Acute hemorrhagic stroke
* Anophthalmia
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Acute patients with a stroke will be included
